medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain started after the patient began aromatase inhibitor therapy and continued even after stopping the therapy. Initially, there was no proximal muscle weakness or tenderness. After a stable course for 3 years, the patient deteriorated over 1 month, developing proximal muscle weakness that made her unable to walk without support, along with bilateral ptosis and difficulty swallowing towards the end of her meals.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of breast cancer and thymectomy; previously on aromatase inhibitor therapy.
